item.title: How do I run Emacs in Server Mode / As a Daemon?
item.description: What does it mean to run Emacs in server mode? Maybe you, like me, have been browsing around with a shell opening files with emacs and find that it isn’t very snappy. Every time you open a text file, you’re loading full blown emacs, which takes (gasp) over a second. Fortunately you can run a single instance of Emacs in the background – a daemon, if you will. This will allow you to open new files using the existing, running emacs instance.

item.title: Welcome Aboard!
item.description: Hello world! It’s been a long time since I’ve had a web site. Guess I’m back! – Luke
